Posts.Content: Hi I havent been around on here for few weeks, been completely floored.  But had to comment on this.   I had lumpectomy and full clearance of underarm lymph nodes and was sent home with drain in.  Tube became disconnected a day later but i was told to reconnect although the vacuum would no longer work.  72 hours later the drain was finally removed. Thr next day my breast began to swell and i ended up with awful infection.  went to hosp to be drained 4 times, each time around a pint of fluid. it wasnt a painful process but non the less i should have been admited at given antibiotics through drip which after 3 weeks i was. this only happened because sat at home having sunday lunch, the centre of one of the op scars breached and began oozing pus. i went to a&e and i basically sat and poured well over a pint out of the hole. I was admitted and given drip antibiotics for 3 days then operation to reopen both scars and flush out all the remaining infection. This all delayed starting chemotherapy and caused immense stress. Please (if u havent already) get intouch with your breast care team and insist they deal with the infection asap and dont be fobbed off being given oral antibiotics which just arent strong enough. I wish you well, hope you get it sorted soon Andrea x
Posts.Title: Post op fluid advice please

Posts.Content: oops i meant i was first diagnosed feb 2010!
Posts.Title: bad news again

Posts.Content: I was diagnosed feb 10 and had lumpectomy and node clearance. then went on to have 6xfec-t chemos, radio and currently on herceptin. Last week went to docs as breast was redder and hotter than usual and thought i may have infection. i was referred to hospital and theyve found a series of cancers in same breast. im devasted and terrified. the hell ive gone thru for last year was all for nothing, the hosp didnt remove it all in first op and now i have to start all over again.  im having mastectomy next tuesday then will begin chemo again. not only have i lost a year of my life, the cancer has been left in my body for a whole year longer to do more damage and spread around i am 38 with 2 young children who have been through hell for past yr and ive just had to tell them its all starting again. my partner works at sea 3 month at a time so im on my own with them and i have no support off any family or friends
Posts.Title: bad news again

Posts.Content: hi thanks for your reply.   i am really scared and struggling not to let myself go into fully blown panic. my breast seems to be getting hotter and more painful & lumpy by the hour and it seems light years away till tuesday when it gets removed.  when i look on this site i cant see any forums etc about locally recurring cancers so it seems pretty unusual.  i feel so let down by the  surgeons who didnt remove it all a year ago, its like theyve given me a death sentence. I have two young children and the thought i may die and leave them absolutely terrifies me.
Posts.Title: bad news again

Posts.Content: Hi Tess, Thankyou so much for your message, I'm so glad your treatment is going well.  Its great to hear some positive news.  I finally have some good news,I rang the hospital today and was told my bone scan is fine.  I cant tell you how relieved I am! I have  a follow up appointment in chemotherapy clinic tomorow to see how the infection is clearing up and im hoping they will let me start having chemotherapy next week.  Im desperate to get started on it asap. Thanks again Tess, take care Andrea x
Posts.Title: bc with alot underarm lymph node involvement

Posts.Content: Hi Sue,  Thankyou for your message.  I find it so reassuring to hear positive experiences like yours.  I so pleased everything has gone so well for you.  It must feel so great to be coming to the end of your treatment. I wish you the best of luck with ther reconstruction, please let me know how everything goes. Take care, Andrea x
Posts.Title: bc with alot underarm lymph node involvement

Posts.Content: hi, ive recently been diagnosed with breast cancer too.  i had lumpectomy and full clearance of lymph nodes as 11 of the 14 removed where diseased.  my ct scan has come back clear but theres an abnormality on my breast bone showing on the bone scan which im really worried about. I know what your going through, all the waiting and uncertainty is so scary. Im terrified to find out results of the bone scan but at same time really want to know so i can finally know what im dealing with.  Im desperate to start chemotherapy which has been delayed because the breast and underarm became really infected following operation and ive had to have another operation to reopen it all and flush infection out as well as havinbg iv antibiotics.  Now waiting for infection to clear before treatment can start. I really hope everything goes ok for you, please let me know how your doing. keep strong, Andrea
Posts.Title: bc with alot underarm lymph node involvement

Posts.Content: Hi ladies, i had my first fec chemo on Tuesday and so far so good.   Ive had a bit of feeling sickly and had dioreha (ignore my misspelling!) and been feeling tired. But on the whole not so bad and today i feel much perkier.  I tried the Paxman cold cap but arent expecting too much so going to get a wig organised too just in case.  i have really long curly hair and if it does start coming out too fast im going to bite the bullet and shave it off.  Dont think i could wear a scarf, i dont want people looking at me knowing i have cancer. Ive noticed a few ladies mention milk being a problem.  is this due to chemo or an ongoing allergy. i drink alot of milk and was wondering if that was what gave me the dioreha. Good to hear bluetit has done ok on her first chemo too.  bring on round 2 and we'll be a third of the way through it!! take care all, Andrea xxx
Posts.Title: had first chemo Fec what else to come!!!

Posts.Content: Hi Katie, thankyou so much for your message.  its so reassuring to hear from people going through this too. I have appointment tomorrow with chemo team so hope to find out which type im having then and get more information.  Its the unknown that frightens me. When i was diagnosed i was told lump was 15mm and nothing in lymph nodes so outlook was very good.  But when i had lumpectomy they found lump was 55mm and they did full clearance of lymph nodes as 11 out of 14 removed where infected.  Chemo nurse told me i was to expect to be blasted with the worst they could give me but as yet i have no idea what that is. Thanks again for sharing your story with me.  i wish you all the very best and would love you to keep in touch and let me know how your getting on. Andrea xx
Posts.Title: had first chemo Fec what else to come!!!

Posts.Content: Hi Chrissi, Thankyou for letting me know how your first chemo has been.  I really dont know what to expect and its very reassuring to hear you seem to have been ok.  Im realising each woman reacts to the chemo in different ways with no two having the same experience. I just keep reminding myself it has too be done and with each one im ridding myself of cancer. its surreal to not actually feel ill or have any 'symptoms' but am about to start a treatment which will make me ill.  Im sure on Tuesday it will suddenly all be very real.  But Im doing my best to keep positive and take each day as it comes. Please keep in touch and let me know how your getting on, take care, Andrea xx
Posts.Title: had first chemo Fec what else to come!!!

Posts.Content: Hi, I'm having my first chemo next tuesday.  Part of me desperate to get it started but other part of me is really scared. I dont know what type im having yet so i dont know what side effects to expect.  i asked doctor what stage or grade im at, but she would only tell me im T3N2M0 which means nothing to me. Does anyone know what that means? Thankyou, take care all. Andrea x
Posts.Title: had first chemo Fec what else to come!!!

Posts.Content: Thankyou Bev, I hope it flies by. Good luck on Tuesday, it must be great to be seeing the end getting closer Andrea xx
Posts.Title: had first chemo Fec what else to come!!!

Posts.Content: Hi all, Ive been to chemo unit today for a look around and been told i'll be having  FEC-T.  Feels alot better and much less scary  to have finally been tol what to expect and be talked through the process. I have first chemo next Tuesday so bring it on!! Take care all, Andrea xxx

Ive just posted Im having first FEC-T on Tuesday and wrote 'bring it on' Having now read what an awful time your having i take  it all back!  I'm so sorry your suffering so much Do you have many sessions to go through? I hope things start to get better for you. Take care, andrea xx

Posts.Content: Hi Sarah, thanks for yr message, i really hope your last two treatments go easier for you then you can start getting stronger again. take good care of you andrea xxx

Hi Katie 54, Did the nurse say you could use fake tan? Im going to a wedding in the summer and wanted to get a spray tan if poss! Thanks all, take care Andrea xxx

Posts.Content: Hi, I'd noticed a few ladies mention black nail polish.  Does this help prevent nail loss and is it just when having Toxotere? Thanks, Andrea xx

Posts.Content: I know!  Though i have to admit im secretly becoming addicted to watching Jeremy Kyle!!
Posts.Title: new member

Posts.Content: i start with chemo on Tuesday. When do you start?
Posts.Title: new member

Posts.Content: Hi Bluetit, I am in same postiion as you, i was diagnosed end of jan and have had 2 ops so far.  I'm due to start chemo on tuesday and have just been for a visit to the chemo unit at the hosp to get talked through what to expect etc. Feels so much better after this visit today as before that i really havent had any idea what to expect and was finding everything very scary. Im to have FEC-T 6 times followed by mascectomy then radio then herceptin.  Do you know which chemo you are to have yet? Be great to keep in touch with you as we're doing this at same time.  I joined this site just a few days ago and have found the people on here so helpful and really helped put my mind at rest. Take care, Andrea XXX
